Appearance
From Wiktionary, the free dictionary
See also: ôser, öser, and øser

French

[edit]

Etymology

[edit]

Inherited from Old French oser, from Late Latin ausāre, frequentative from Latin audeō. Compare Occitan ausar.

Pronunciation

[edit]
  • IPA(key): /o.ze/
  • Audio:(file)
  • Audio (France (Somain)):(file)

Verb

[edit]

oser

  1. to dare
    Je n'ose pas lui dire la vérité.
    I don't dare to tell him the truth.
  2. (Switzerland) to be allowed to

1 The French gerund is usable only with the preposition en.
2 In less formal writing or speech, these tenses may be found to have been replaced in the following way:
past historic → present perfect
past anterior → pluperfect
imperfect subjunctive → present subjunctive
pluperfect subjunctive → past subjunctive

(Christopher Kendris [1995], Master the Basics: French, pp. 77, 78, 79, 81).

Related terms

[edit]
  • audace

Further reading

[edit]
  • “oser”, in Trésor de la langue française informatisé [Digitized Treasury of the French Language], 2012.

Anagrams

[edit]
  • Éros, ores, rose, Rose

Norwegian Nynorsk

[edit]

Verb

[edit]

oser

  1. present of osa

Old French

[edit]

Etymology

[edit]

From Late Latin ausāre, frequentative from Latin audēre.

Verb

[edit]

oser

  1. to dare

Conjugation

[edit]

This verb conjugates as a first-group verb ending in -er. The forms that would normally end in *-ss, *-st are modified to s, st. Old French conjugation varies significantly by date and by region. The following conjugation should be treated as a guide.

    Conjugation of oser (see also Appendix:Old French verbs)
simple compound
infinitive oser avoir osé
gerund en osant gerund of avoir + past participle
present participle osant
past participle osé
person singular plural
first second third first second third
indicative jo tu il nos vos il
simple
tenses 		present os oses ose osons osez osent
imperfect osoie, oseie, osoe, oseve osoies, oseies, osoes, oseves osoit, oseit, osot, oseve osiiens, osiens osiiez, osiez osoient, oseient, osoent, osevent
preterite osai osas osa osames osastes oserent
future oserai oseras osera oserons oseroiz, osereiz, oserez oseront
conditional oseroie, osereie oseroies, osereies oseroit, osereit oseriiens, oseriens oseriiez, oseriez oseroient, osereient
compound
tenses 		present perfect present tense of avoir + past participle
pluperfect imperfect tense of avoir + past participle
past anterior preterite tense of avoir + past participle
future perfect future tense of avoir + past participle
conditional perfect conditional tense of avoir + past participle
subjunctive que jo que tu qu’il que nos que vos qu’il
simple
tenses 		present os os ost osons osez osent
imperfect osasse osasses osast osissons, osissiens osissoiz, osissez, osissiez osassent
compound

— ose — osons osez —
